gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਜਾਰ ਚੋਰ ਓਰ ਹੇਰਤਿ ਨ ਅਾਹਿ ਕੋੳੂ ਚੋਰ ਜਾਰ ਜਾਨਤ ਸਕਲ ਭੂਤ ਹੇਰਹੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Jaar Chor Aor Hayrati N Aahi Kooo , Chor Jaar Jaanat Sakal Bhoot Hayrahee ?
translation: Just as in normal circumstances no one pays attention to a thief or a paramour, but once it becomes known, they look like demons.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਦਿਨ ਸਮੈ ਅਾਵਾਗਵਨ ਭਵਨ ਬਿਖੈ ਤਾਹੀ ਗ੍ਹਿ ਪੈਸਤ ਸੰਕਾਤ ਹੈ ਅੰਧੇਰ ਹੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Din Samai Aavaagavan Bhavan Bikhai , Taahee Grih Paisat Sankaat Hai Andhayr Hee ?
translation: Just as one keeps going in and out of a house freely, but at night during darkness one feels scared of entering the same house.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਧਰਮਾਤਮਾ ਕੳੁ ਦੇਖੀਅੈ ਧਰਮਰਾੲਿ ਪਾਪੀ ਕੳੁ ਭੲਿਅਾਨ ਜਮ ਤ੍ਰਾਹ ਤ੍ਰਾਹ ਟੇਰਹੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Dharamaatamaa Kau Daykheeai Dharamaraai , Paapee Kau Bhaiaan Jam Traah Traah Tayrahee ?
translation: Just as the Yamraj (angel of death) is the King of righteousness for a righteous person at the time of his death, but the same Yamraj is a demon for a sinner who. appears to him as a demon and he shouts for help for his safety.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਨਿਰਵੈਰ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਦਰਪਨ ਰੂਪ ਤੈਸੇ ਹੀ ਦਿਖਾਵੈ ਮੁਖ ਜੈਸੇ ਜੈਸੇ ਫੇਰਹੀ ||੬੪੩||
transliteration: Taisay Niravair Satigur Darapan Roopa , Taisay Hee Dikhaavai Moukh Jaisay Jaisay Dhayrahee ?643?
translation: Similarly the True Guru is sans enmity, with a heart as clear and clean as a mirror. He wishes ill of no one. But with whatever type of face one turns towards Him, he sees the True Guru in the same form (For righteous people, He is love and for sinners he
